content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Split markdown document into lines
    lines = split(md, "\n")

    # Initialize an empty string to store extracted code
    extracted_code = ""

    # Loop through each line of the markdown document
    for line in lines
        # If a line starts with `###`, it is not part of a code block
        if line[1:3] == "###" || occursin(r"\s*```\s*julia", line)
            continue
        end

        # If the previous line was part of a code fence and this line is not, close the code fence
        if line != "```" && last(extracted_code) == "```"
            append!(extracted_code, "\n")
        end

        # Append current line to extracted code string
        append!(extracted_code, line * "\n")
    end

    return stripped_julia_code = replace(extracted_code, r"^\s*```\s*julia\s*$|\s*```\s*julia\s*\n?$" => "")
end
